lines.text: Oh, well done!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yay! We're going to have a great journey!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was impressive. You put her in her place.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I did!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Asserted yourself, but you were--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Firm, but polite, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You were firm, but fair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Firm, but fair. Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am very, very nervous that somebody is going to die when we fight this dragon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I hope it's me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh! So, protection against ice magic. Does anybody have stuff that works for that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Didn't we need to go to Uncle Randy's?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lyra do you know any--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well, we were going to go and get some...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yeah, we're going to go to the warehouse that's on the edge of the district.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Where we're going, we're going to get some furs and all that sort of stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough. You guys follow Lyra down to the outside of the Quadroads. There is one warehouse she goes to, she knocks on the door and as it opens up, you can see a rather comely looking gentleman with a nice soft, almost a purple-blue beret. Little bit of a heavyset neck bulge that rests over the top of his little doublet. And he opens it and he looks up. "Eh, what can I-- oh Lyra."

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Hi! Oh my gosh. How are you?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groans) "What do you want this time?"

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well, it's funny. Because I finally got an assignment with the guild! Can you believe it? It's like whoa! Uncle Randy's going to be so--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I can't believe it."

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh. Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But good for you."

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Thank you! So anyway, me and my friends-- these are my friends now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what? She's sort of our leader.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hello.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you must know, Randy.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Right?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gives a very, very long, judgmental, mistrusting look across all five of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we call you uncle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please, don't." (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what, Mister Randy? We had our doubts about your--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, no that's not-- No no no no, he's not my uncle. No-- my uncle is not here, he's just-- this is just one of his--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Managers. Yeah, very important.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: He's going to be-- Uncle Randy is going to eat his hat, isn't he? I got a leadership position! Anyway, can you help us out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What do you need, Lyra?"

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: We're going into the cold-- we're going into a blizzard, can you believe that? And you know how much I hate the cold, but we do need to be provisioned, so what do we have in the crates that we can help...?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A minute goes by.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Um, I thought--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two minutes go by.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, he's going to hook us up. He's going to hook us up, really.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Uh! (Knocks)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I use Mask of Many Faces and I disguise myself as Uncle Frank.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Uncle Randy?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Frankly, my dear! I am Uncle Randy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bob? Peter?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't talk to Frank anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You have not seen Uncle Randy.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, balls!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is the only downside to that.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Balls and a half!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Um. You could-- (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There's no pictures on the wall anywhere I could look at outside?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just go on Facebook. Facebook!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: A great big, beautiful... this is where he sells things! Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, no. But if there's any other form you'd like to take you're welcome to.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (whispers) Bollocks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, bloody hell. I'm going to knock loudly.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well, this is just very-- this is is a very egg-on-face situation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's looking for stuff, right? He's--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door opens at this point, almost pushing you back on your heels. You catch yourself as he comes out carrying a large pile of what look like relatively well-kept furs and thick leather cloaks, and shoves them into your arms. "Be safe, little one." (bff) Closes the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bye.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll try to get her back in one piece.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Thank you. That's sweet. See? I came through, guys. I came through.

lines.name: TALIESIN, SAM
lines.text: You did!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Just remember, that I came through.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll write a good comment card when we get back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I get the one that's slit up the back so my tail doesn't--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, we're loaded up. We've got horses, we've got healing potions, we've got--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Loaded for bear, as it were.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're great. Trinket's wonderful.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes, he is!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He nuzzles up alongside Vex.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shall we set off?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go? Yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes, let's do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want to go, one more time to the Braving Grounds, Grog, and just--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Try your hand against-- no?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why don't we slay the dragon first, and then--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then he can punch things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Since we're on a time crunch, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're right. You're right, there is a--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Everyone is good on weapons?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'd say yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I haven't finished my training montage yet. Got to run through the snow, got to do pullups on trees.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (sings) Gonna need a montage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Inverted sit-ups--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (sings) Even Phillip had a--

lines.name: MARY, TRAVIS
lines.text: (sings) Montage!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hand... Road.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Glasswalk Road.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You embark on the Glasswalk Road, which forms right on the outskirts of the Braving Grounds. You are let through the front gates of the outside of the Vesper Timberlands, and this is the first time you've actually seen a formal road that is carved and at least traversed enough that the Timberland hasn't completely consumed it. You can still see various tree roots and branches are progressively, almost angrily, pushing in towards this gate, but you get the feeling based on the cuts that whoever goes through here-- at least some people go through here, they keep it relatively well-kept for travel up north. You ride out into it and the canopy almost completely encloses it, so it's like a tunnel of very dense tree, vine, and leaf structure. You push forward out into the cold air and begin to ride for the remainder of the day. A good eight or nine hours hit before the chill begins to grow. The sun begins to find itself setting across the far mountains, and the forest around you grows darker and darker still.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably need to make camp.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I think we should make camp! I-- should we make camp? Yes! We should make camp!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I shall take first watch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a firewood bundle that we can make a fire with.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's also lots of wood around, Grog.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I find a really tiny tree and start hacking away at it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tiny?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, tiny. We don't need to kill, like, Grandpa Tree. We kill Baby Tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth would be proud.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't-- how about don't tell Keyleth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I miss my brother.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys get off of the main road, as that's probably not a very good area to be out in the open. You find, after about a five to ten minute walk, a small opening and along the way you find a tree that looks viable. There's a small slope of hill that heads up to an upper platform area maybe about five to ten feet up, and a small opening that you think would be a fitting place to put a fire that wouldn't be in danger of setting the nearby vegetation aflame. You go ahead and start looking for firewood. Go ahead and make an athletics roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. After a good 15, 20 minute period-- relatively brief for most folk-- you come back with a nice, hefty stack of firewood from the driest small tree you could find.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, Zahra?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Well done.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Impressed?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kord's strength to you, sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Throwing the wood down, you begin to set up small stones into a fire pit establishment, and begin building a fire as the entirety of the sun disappears behind the distant mountain range. At this point, the temperature has gotten extremely cold, and most of you begin to pull up your winter cloaks and get your bedrolls ready for an evening's bit of rest. Is there anything in particular that you guys want to do before the night and sleep take you?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I would like to go out. Has the moon risen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About two hours into nightfall, you can see a gentle bit of moonlight begin to appear off the distant horizon to the northeast, from your position. It's hard to see because the trees are so thick, but you take a moment to walk through, and you can see little bits of the moonlight peeking.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I just bask in what little rays I can for ten, 15 minutes before retiring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Anything else you wish to do?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm going to change my stone, my Transmuter Stone, to be resisting ice or cold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, that's really good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Clever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good call. Good call, indeed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I need something like that. Do we have any magic stuff that makes us resistant?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I have a Ring of Protection. May I do that around the camp?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Ring of Protection is an actual ring you wear.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh! I have a ring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and it protects you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And it protects me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. (laughs)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You see? I'm learning everything. Not all at once.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have one, too.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, you do? Oh, yours is nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very helpful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but we don't have any ice-resistant things, outside of that damn--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or fire spells. Fire spells would be very--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, I have a fire spell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's how I took down the worg. So, anyway, we were in the forest--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How powerful is it? Because I can conjure something and it would be very-- too large for this particular--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I mean, I think a Fireball would not help here. I can do Firebolt, but there's really no use until we get there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we starting a fire?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I can start the fire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we not have a fire going?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, of course we do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys look over and Grog is sitting there, rubbing wood together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, one second. Here--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fine. Take all the joy out of everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ranger, who is very well-experienced in surviving in woodland areas, starts the fire that had taken you a good five, six minutes of aggressively fighting against the water-soaked wood of this woodland. (snaps) She lights the flames.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I warmed it up first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you, Grog. You did. You really did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. You're welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Anyone keeping watch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll keep watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you're taking first watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take first watch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She had already-- Zahra had volunteered.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Zahra had first watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take second watch, then.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: You can take second watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Zahra takes first watch. Percy takes second watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I watch with Zahra?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Third watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Third watch for Grog. All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No watch.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm-- I would take watch, just for the record, but I just get so peckish--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You just sleep. You need your beauty rest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sleeping, yes. Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to be clear for leading tomorrow.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: There was one time, when I--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, man. No, no, yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I think-- shall we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: First watch, Percy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, is it you and I?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm second watch.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As the rest of you make your bedrolls, prepare and gather around the fire, eventually drift off to sleep. Vex and Zahra are left awake.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You need help carrying your purse? Your bag?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no. It's quite comfortable against my side, actually.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Could I feel how heavy it is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not heavy at all. We don't have anything in it, darling.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where do you come from?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (exhales) I come--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just don't see very many tieflings around here.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No. I come from very far away. It took quite a long time for me to get here. I come from the land of Feren.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Feren.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes. Very far-off, mountainous, dark. Very dark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And you left because...?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: My father was killed, and I was left on my own in the woods, so I left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounds familiar.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, it does?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, actually.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Why? Why is that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My mother was killed.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: She was?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: By whom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A dragon. (sighs) I wonder if it was white.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I wonder if it was.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. I mean, (snores)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What about your father?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My father's alive.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And what is he?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: An asshole, actually.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Really? Mine was an asshole too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: He was. He was a dark wizard. He was awful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wow. Mine's just a jerk.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: He kept me in a cage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Zahra.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Getting a bit personal here around the fire.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sorry. I thought we were bonding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Here. Have some food.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Thank you. God, what is this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Disgusting. Grog found it. I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's wood.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is it wood? All right, well at least it's elm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you take up second watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About three, four hours go by--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispers) Oh, bollocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Without incident. Eventually, your watch comes to a close. You find yourself just past the middle of the night period of the evening. Who has the third watch? Is that--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog. All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wake up, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Mom? (screams and flails)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh. Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is he always this loud?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, keep sleeping! (whispers) I mean, keep sleeping. You're safe while I'm out.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Aldor! What? Huh? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rest of you maintain or continue your sleep. Grog keeps a very watchful eye in the darkened woods around. Grog, go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. Me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, he's the worst.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I see everything. Yes! Minus... 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you're keeping your eyes around for any sort of dangerous or encroaching villainy, the fire itself is slightly mesmerizing in its pattern, and you look off to the right. You hear the slight snapping of a twig about 15, 20 feet off from the camp.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go to check it out by myself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? (groans)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You stand up, lifting your axe and begin to take a few steps away from the camp. As you turn around one of the nearby tree trunks, the first thing you're greeted by in the darkness-- do you have Darkvision?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have low-- Wait, the Dwarven Belt of Beard Power gives me-- I have Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. So as you turn the corner, you get about a step before you notice, about 15 feet away from you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your beard tingles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a very large fur-covered, wolf-like creature that is (snarls).

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is it a worg?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Snarling at you with bony protrusions from parts of its body. It stands, from ground to top of its shoulder, almost up to your entire height, and it is currently snarling, and behind it you can see there are two very gingerly stepping humanoid figures in the darkness.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (chuckles) I yell out, PLAYTIME!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all wake up--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Where is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And we'll be back here. We're also going to show a really cool video as we recently put up our challenge to the Critter-verse-- of all the Critters that watch the show, the-- (chuckles), the Cancer Cream Pie Challenge. Those of you who haven't seen it can go look it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cream cancer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cream cancer.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Cream cancer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cancer of the cream.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cancer of the cream, if you will. A bunch of our fans took up the challenge, and there's a wonderful video compilation of that. We'll go ahead and put that up here in a moment, but we'll be back shortly to to see what dangers have been unveiled in the nearby forest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're working out some kinks and appreciate you hanging with us in that, and things will progressively get better as we push forward from here. We hope you like the new format. This is all put together by our wonderful Overlord and his crack team of twitch experts. Also, wanted to mention to you guys the '5k and a bear' t-shirts that are up because of the ridiculous Trinket--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 5k arrival from last week's episode, is available for one more day. So if you want to get that, get it soon, because once it's gone it's gone. So make sure to go check that out if you're interested. Other than that, are we good to go ahead and continue? Perfect. All right. First and foremost, I would like everyone to roll initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh God.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How did I just immediately forget that's what we were doing?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How do I do that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You take a d20.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And roll it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eh.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: (retches)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look at that. Add initiative, which is...

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh. Heh. I don't know how that's possible, but yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. Better.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, it's a pen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There should be a laser in there somewhere.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So that way you can vaguely say, move me there.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I love it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! I have to put my glasses on today.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yeah, it's far away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean your magic glasses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My magic glasses of seeing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is so exciting!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mary and Felicia don't know. This is fun, come on.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: This is amazing, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool. So. Initiative rolls for everyone--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Blind Matt Mercer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There will be a mild surprise round here except for Grog, but we have initiatives from here. Percy, what you got?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 for Percy. Felicia?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Four! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Thank you, Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Lyra and Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy crap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh God. Why did we all roll terribly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys. (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll be dead. We'll be dead before we leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh this is wonderful, you're all going to die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're all going to die, man!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's never a good sign.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I should have grabbed some of that dessert that's here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you were 16 as well?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just had a couple. They're great, and I'm sure Liam could get us some more.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Maybe your brother--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So. In this regard, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are actually going first. Everyone else, you're currently in the process of waking up so there's going to be a round before it gets to the rest of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket! Wake up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket wakes up. Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look, and you see the big, dire wolf-like creature is currently staring at you across the way, and you see other entities, humanoid, coming towards you. As your Darkvision allows you to take up their features you can see these are very heavily fur covered, dense leather armor protected, roving band of straight up orcs that are currently converging on the campsite from the center of the woods. What are you going to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to Rage, and I will charge the dire wolf puppy-thing and swing at its head with my great-axe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you immediately go into a Grog-style charge. You guys can hear Grog yelling in furious anger, echoing through the nearby wood in the direction you heard his initial shout that woke you up. Grog, you rush forward towards the dire wolf. Go ahead and make your two attacks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. Go ahead and roll some damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. Ten and 18, is 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Slamming into its shoulder, you can see as you draw the axe out of the wound, you've left a nice hearty gash into the muscle tissue that holds its arm to its shoulder. The other one, as you bring your axe around the other side it slams into the upper part of its back. It sinks a good three or four inches into it and the dire wolf (rrgaaah) just reacts to the pain with a guttural screech and then looks up at you, releasing its lips apart for these nasty looking, sharp, long dire wolf fangs revealed as it prepares itself to pounce back. That ends your turn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As part of this round, the dire wolf is going to return, as the two nearest orcs charge in to flank Grog.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy is going to move... One, two, three... six... can't quite-- there. Is going to use its action to dash in here and loom over. So as you're waking up you see this orc come lumbering around one of the trees--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no! You? You're eating!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- with this giant club and just gets in front of you. As you're freaking out, another one flanks around and comes up towards Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hm!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see, behind-- another growl and a series of heavy footfalls as-- not quite an ogre, not quite an orc; like some sort-of ogre/orc crossbreed, comes walking behind one of the other trees to go up behind Percy on that side

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh God!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my Grog.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Oh my Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And from the far end over here another orc moves forward one, two, three, four, five... six-- And he's going to use his action to finish his movement here on Percy, as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh God!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they attacking Percy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Currently there's only two attacks on you from this ogre-like creature and this orc. Oh, that's not going to be very good. That would be a nine?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your AC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, that is not going to hit. And then we also have-- that'll be a 22.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's going to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so the giant ogre-ish type creature comes rushing towards you. Swings with its giant club and slams the ground next you as you manage to roll out of the way and get up to your feet, and as you do the orc to the other side swings with what looks like a heavy axe and it nicks you in the side of the shoulder blade, dealing 12 points of slashing damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hm!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have-- this guy just barely gets to Scanlan. Scanlan, as you're standing up one of the orcs rushes up behind and you see he's holding another large, double-handed great axe--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I sing-- (sings) No I don't want to get hurt, by you. Doo doo doo doo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll the d10 to reduce the attack modifier on that one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Where does this come from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rolled a 24 by the way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so I reduce that by two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, so he'll still hit, but he got a song out of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Lucky bastard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well there you go. All right, that will come to another 12 points of slashing damage. As the axe swings down, you manage to just pull out of the way so it hits the armor and deflects, but it leaves a huge gash in the front of the armor and just the sheer weight of it kind of shook you for a second.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ahh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll bring us to Grog, who is currently being heavily flanked. First the dire wolf is going to snatch at you because it's not happy with your series of attacks, and with Pack Tactics it has advantage because it's within five feet of other allies. So, its bite attack against you with advantage is a-- natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Using my new Critical Role dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're all going to die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thanks chatroom. Thank you.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes, chatroom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's 21 points of piercing damage from the jaws which is reduced by half because of your Rage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, so 11?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. That finishes the dire wolf's turn. The two other orcs are also going to swing at you from the sides. They have advantage because they're flanking you. That's going to be a 17.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back at the top of the order we have Percy. What are you doing first?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Going to cry a little. So, I have three orcs basically-- or two orcs and a god-knows-what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's too small to be an ogre but it's too big to be an orc. A very unholy union of the two probably created this spawn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The first thing I'm going to do, is I'm going to take a Fire Shot to the right to that giant monstrosity and spend a Grit point to try to shoot him in the foot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, these rules are new, so pardon me if I'm a little iffy. So shot with Pepperbox is-- wow, what's wrong with me? 28 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28 definitely hits. He has to make a saving throw or be knocked prone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He has to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eight plus my proficiency modifier plus my dexterity modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four plus six, so it would be 18?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's actually ten. 18, yeah, you're right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he does not make that. So you shoot, he gets knocked prone. As you shoot his foot out from under him, he stumbles to one knee and then you just kick out and push him onto his back. That's the first shot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And it does six points of damage-- I'm sorry, it does 12 points of damage plus three points of fire damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to shoot him while he's down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So, do I get a bonus to hit there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have advantage because he's prone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I get advantage. So I'm actually using--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's right there in front of you and he's not able to really dodge effectively, so I'm going to give you advantage on this attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so I'm using Sharpshooter then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get him Percy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank God. Natural 20! So, this is going to suck for him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which regenerates your Grit point you just used, by the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it? I'm back to three?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a Grit point whenever you crit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Every time I crit, that's right! Math! Okay, so I get double points right? That's how this--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll the dice and double the number you get.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While it's on the ground, it looks up at you and snarls. You removed your boot from where you kicked it down. You bring the gun down, aim it, and give it a glare as you fire with the Pepperbox. As you do, you blast part of its jaw off and you see it-- You see blood starting to trickle and pour down the front of its chest and it's trying to get up angrily, reaching for its club which is currently in the half snow floor of this forest interior. It's looking pretty rough, but it's looking very intent on getting vengeance on you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Out of idle curiosity, if I try to make a break for it they would get two attacks of opportunity against me, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Yes, they are harrying you pretty heavily right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh, that doesn't make my life any better does it. No, never mind then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do it, Percy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, you know what? I'm pulling an Action Surge. Two more shots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm shooting him two more times while he's on the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Same thing with a plus ten to hit with a Sharpshooter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. He still has--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Advantage to your shot because he's still on the ground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 23 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 hits. Go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: five plus 16, so 21 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Instakill!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Damn! One turn!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now, I'm going to take that last shot and swing up and shoot at the one that's to the right of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That one right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and roll to attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, God. Natural 20!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the fuck?!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: What the heck?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the best night for Percy, ever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just sitting in the corner going (maniacal laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You were sleeping. Are you doing all this naked, since you were woken up so quickly?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, definitely.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm in the pajamas with the butt flap, and the butt flap is down.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The butt flap is down!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I applaud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Good to know, because that will affect your armor class.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that's eight, 16, 26, 27, 28, 29, 31, 32 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 32 points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's insane.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a crit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we all get inspiration from seeing Percy just massacre?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's like a John Woo film right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right? With the doves--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all are a little distracted by the other ones that are currently pushing in. You hear the explosions and you see off to the corner, but you have too many things around you right now. Okay, so as you pull back the gun, the orc that's in front of you that's currently holding its one handed axe with two hands is rearing back. You fire right towards its face. It tries to duck out of the way and you smack into its shoulder. With an explosion you can see its leather armor splinters, and its fur kind of burns and curls back from the flame of the blast, and beneath you can see that most of the muscle tissue and exposed bone is visible as you've blown a giant crater in its shoulder.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gross!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was brilliant. I'm done. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I would like to take one giant swing in a half circle, trying to get all three at one time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so attack for each one. Go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So that's a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits the orc. Dire wolf.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits. And for the last orc.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hell yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, roll damage three times, and it's in order. This orc over here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you (whoosh) swing the axe around, it clips across the chest of the orc who is almost pushed off his feet from the sheer force. The axe swings, slams into the front throat, chest area of the dire wolf with so much force that it cuts clean through leaving this open wound where its main veins just begin to pour its lifeblood.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Ew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the inertia carrying through its body it slams into the other orc, who actually has a small buckler shield that manages to catch. It shatters most of the leather and metal that encompasses the piece, getting stuck into his forearm and he yells in your face with this kind of guttural shout and he pulls his own arm off the blade of the axe as you withdraw it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That concludes your turn. It's now their turn. All you low initiative rolling motherfuckers got to wait! (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (sings) Mother! Motherfucker!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see. First and foremost, the two guys that are-- in that motion, the two orcs that you just slammed rear back and then retaliate very heavily against you. They both have advantage because they have you flanked. That'll be 22.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a 14.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. All right. So the one with the buckler and what looks like a longsword strikes you for eight points of slashing damage, of which you take four.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 14.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I have a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Aw, okay. So, as its two handed axe swings down on top of you, you take six points of slashing damage.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Ouch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You instinctively freak out and back up out of the way and it actually doesn't hit you, it slams into your bedroll. But the sheer impact shakes you and you can feel the sweat beginning to pour from your forehead. That's going to bring us to this guy here, who's attacking Scanlan. That's going to be a 12.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Miss!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He swings towards your head. Thankfully he's not used to attacking things so small. You duck quickly out of the way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck you! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's-- Oh, and the two on Percy, who are now looking for retribution. They're looking a little shaken by the whole experience. The one that you shot in the shoulder too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just screaming in their face like a manic pixie. (screams)

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Manic pixie dream gunslinger.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll be a 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I walked into that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 to hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to spend a Grit point and-- Wait, if my armor class is 20, does that mean they still hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I thought you were wearing your pajamas with the butt flap?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: LAURA:That's so mean.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For now, fine. That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sometimes you-- This is what I heard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The visualization was worth it alone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And 22 for the second attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So both of them strike at once. You don't quite know which way to dodge, and as you try to duck out of the way both blades hit you simultaneously on the sides.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That one rolled pretty high, you take 12.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 12 total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The total would be 16.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 16 points of slashing damage from the two of those orcs. Now we come to Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I turn to the orc who just missed me and I cast Dominate Person.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With my-- through my Hand Cone of Clarity, of course.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So, as you finish your casting of the spell you can see the anger in its face suddenly drop and subside, and it gives you this expectant look.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I command him to protect our goliath, with his life if he needs to, and retreat from me instantly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It nods and looks over towards where Grog is and with this kind of slack jawed expression turns and looks like it's ready to make its way towards Grog next round. Do you want to move at all? Or are you staying here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will move a step towards Lyra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you step back with the fire to your back, you can feel the heat flickering behind you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I will just be backup for her, and I also will inspire her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It could be an attack, could be a saving throw.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay, great. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can roll and if that's not enough, you can add a d10 to it.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay, great. That's so nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that ends Scanlan's turn. Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to cast-- How many people are on Percy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two currently, flanking him right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to do Hunter's Mark on the damaged one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I get-- Yeah, the one that's damaged.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that's damaged the most is going to be this one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's the one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Through my-- I'm going to shoot him through my Flaming Bow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I also am going to have Trinket attack him twice. How about that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Trinket runs around the tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Never happened before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An unexpected circumstance. So as you turn around, you go ahead and you point at the orc to the side with a flicker of slightly shimmering white energy. You can see your attention focus and clarity crystallize on this one orc who glances over at you, returning the gaze.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 19 attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 attack does hit. And as the arrow is released from your bow--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus the d10 for the flaming. 17 to hit, and then Trinket's attacks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he looks down you hear this guttural growl from around the corner. As he glances over Trinket comes jumping out of the shadows from behind the tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket! I never know what to look at because I never attack with Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Attack bonus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. That's 22 for one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits. Roll for the second attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The second one is a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 just barely hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my goodness!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Trinket's doing something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! You guys! Does that mean he can bite twice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One is going to be bite and one is going to be claws.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And he dies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I didn't do Hunter's Mark on the previous one. Four for Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four additional damage for Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 13. No 12, for one attack. And then-- What did I just do? I did it wrong. That was wrong.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Is 11 for the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 for the first one. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then the second one. This is so new and exciting. And 12 for the second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket leaps on top, reaches down and with its jaws around its head just bites the head off.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ohh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you see the head flip into the air, catches the head in his jaws and crunches down on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! Have a meal, buddy!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, you want to cuddle with that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hell yeah I do!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zahra, it's your go.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. Is that an orc right behind me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is Vex right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's me.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, I can't see where I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're right here.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Okay. Who are the three strongest orcs right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One, two, three, four.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And I can only Hex one creature, is this correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. I'm going to Hex the one by-- in the back, sorry. I'm going to Hex him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Him? All right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And I'm going to incant Agonizing Blast, and cast Eldritch Blast on those three orcs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've never heard of any of these things.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Because there's three blasts that come from, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, Eldritch Blast is three different beams, and that's just Eldritch Blast for your turn. Or you can do Agonizing Blast, you choose one or the other.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, I thought Agonizing Blast was a--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cantrip?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. It's one of your abilities?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it just improves the Eldritch Blast?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, you can totally do that.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I want to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you turn around--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'd like to do that with my Staff of Dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hold the staff forward and for a second your eyes, which are normally a vibrant bright white suddenly close with this darkness and then reveal a pale blue like the moon in the sky. As you do, this hue of light blue energy begins to emanate from this orc right there. He looks down confused as you pull your staff up and slam the ground with it. As you do, these three streaks of pale, blueish green energy streak out towards it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Ha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll three attacks.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Adding your bonus-- your spell bonus to each one.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 13 plus 11.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That was a good one. 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30. Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you adding the plus--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh and plus two to each of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's damage.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. So it's Eldritch Blast, it gets plus 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. So what was the last one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all hit, so go ahead and roll damage for each, and each does additional Hex damage, because it's three different hits.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes. And the damage is 1d10 plus seven times three?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Too much math.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 1d10 plus seven, 1d10 plus seven, 1d10 plus seven.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Okay. Oh, help me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not a d10, that's a d12.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sorry. Sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's a guest.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'm a guest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you know what, I was rolling eights instead of tens. That's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Too late now. Next time.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Two plus seven. Two plus seven is ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Two plus seven is nine, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Ten plus seven is 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And five plus seven is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. And then then add-- roll a d6 three times because each time you blast them you do the additional Hex damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy crap what are you?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right two.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight total.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like a Hunter's Mark all on your own.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, after the beams streak out-- all three blast simultaneously into the torso area of the orc that's standing by Percy. It's glaring at you with this look of surprise, and fury, and frustration and before it can even try and mount any sort of attack, the three beams strike it in the chest. You can see this scattering of brackish liquid as the back of its torso is blown out like a shotgun blast.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it falls to the ground with this gurgle in its throat, and for a second you swear you see the glistening moonlight colored energy that you had Hexed upon it almost sucks the soul from its body and then it dissipates into the air above it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A big blast of flame. Great. So that will end your turn there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You did really well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How is she so cool?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She just changed the game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That will bring us to Lyra.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She can stay.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Is that 30 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30. 30 foot is right there. From you.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Who are the bad guys? This one, this one, and this one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one, this one, and these two there.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay. So I'm like-- (screams) Oh, that was cool. Okay. (pff) And I use my Chain Lightning. You have to do a save on that. That just automatically hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That just hits, yeah.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay, so it's 10d8.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To whom?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: To one guy, and then it can hit up to three people within 30 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they within 30 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These two are not but this guy is.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Ten, is 21. Plus 21 plus 24. 21 plus 24 is-

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: 45 points of damage to that guy, and then it goes to the other guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy there. These guys are a little too far away, unfortunately. This guy is not.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, okay. Get that guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He did take half damage to that one. But this one is blown off the map. The other one over here is looking pretty rough now. It's hobbling forward currently with one of its legs ruined.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) That poor orc!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty rough. It's been a rough day for him. Do you want to stay where you are or do you want to move?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'll stay where I am. Wow, that worked!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Suck it up, Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Top of the round. Percy, Grog.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You first or I? I'm going to start running towards Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How far can I get? About that far. And while I'm running I'm just going to take-- Oh hello, where are we? There we are. I'm just going to take two pot shots at him as I'm running by.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My dominated guy is not going to live to see his--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And just because I don't really care I'm going to take the negative-- the Sharpshooter plus damage negative to that. So.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 does hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'll just do both right now. And--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you get another 20?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got another 20!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's a very good dice. That's a very good die.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can spread them out over several games. You don't have to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to fight dragons soon. A dragon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 20 points of damage for the first shot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Leave none alive, my boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First shot smacks into its thigh, and you can see where once there was an actual functional thigh area is now a splintered femur that is exposed through one side of his leg. You can see it's barely keeping itself standing. It roars out (raaah!) in pain as you fire again--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 32 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the final bullet in your Pepperbox's chamber, the sixth bullet, you fire the last round--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to make me change the Sharpshooter thing by the end of this round I get the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no, no. Sharpshooter works well for a reason.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's kind of spectacular. I keep rolling 20s! I keep rolling 20s!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's what the dice does, man. It's worked poorly in your favor before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really poorly, normally!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's great when it works awesomely. So with this look of confusion as this orc that's trying to do the bidding of this gnome that--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Protect our goliath!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's trying desperately to go and protect Grog but on the way there it gets its leg blown out, and then suddenly it turns and the shot enters one side of its temple and out the other and there's just this very quick (shpt) sound as it falls to the ground motionless and is no longer a living organism.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good job Percy. I sort of had that guy covered but it's all good. It's all good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm coming, Grog!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For the gentleman that I'm facing right now, I would like to take my first swing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well all right, 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. That hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And that is 19 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whew. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take my second swing at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Same guy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Same guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Also 19 points of damage.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: After the Hammer, orcs are nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, the first strike you slam into his upper torso area and it actually digs about four or five inches in. He reaches up and grabs-- drops his weapon and grabs the axe and tries to pull it out of his body. You, however, reach up with your fist and slam it down on the axe shoving it about five or six more inches. You can see his actual shoulder and arm fall away from his torso as his eyes roll back and he falls limp against the blade.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With my third attack, I'd like to turn to his friend, grab him by the throat and go-- It's death, or target practice for my friends. Talk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an intimidation roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yay. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The orc, looking at its current fate and the rather rapid destruction of its entire band-- (speaks Orcish) Anyone here speak Orcish?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I speak Orc. So, my friend--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did he say? What did he say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear him say, "Death may come, but the rest will find you. You come into our wood. It's "only a matter of time before you're eaten."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell him we're just passing through.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We are simply passing through. We are in search of something. If you choose to help us, we may let you live.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, 'may'.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And it is not one of yours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What do I roll?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What do I add to it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus your persuasion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Heck yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're speaking to him in his own language, his--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (speaks Orcish)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bless you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You guys hear these horrible guttural sounds, almost as good as Keyleth's Giant.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Almost.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks down at the dead dire wolf. He gives you another look and you still have the flaring blaze of your angry Thaumaturgy eyes. He says in Common, very broken Common-- "Very well. I live. I serve." You can see his blood now trickling down to the corner of his mouth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What, is he going to fight with us?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Can I see if he's truthful? Insight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Aw, that's not my strength.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try, though!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh good, I rolled a four!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus two!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Plus two!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks.... constipated? That's the best way you can read it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I try as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're welcome to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Constipated?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're concerned, briefly, for the diet he usually eats. Vex, you wanna go ahead?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 16, is what I rolled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? Ah, there is definitely an intent for self-preservation, but there is that fight-or-flight look in the eyes as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let me kill him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, let's find out about our dragon first.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh! I can cast Friend on him.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, because he'll know you're casting magic and then he'll come back at you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He will.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Is that why it never worked on Aldor?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes, and he'll come back and attack you afterwards and it can only be used for--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do you know?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Friends! Well, I can cast Friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Friends, however, has to be on something that's not hostile, and you get the feeling that even though he's currently docile, he's probably a little hostile.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay, okay. I guess we'll just go without.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Suggestion only works-- but Mass Suggestion works for a long time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why don't we just ask him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah! We got him! We can kill him in a second if we have to, so--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You know we can kill you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a dragon. Where is it?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We are looking for a dragon. Specifically, a white dragon, and we know it is to the north--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: West.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: -- west.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This beast, I see-- in the sky. Takes those who do not hide. Look for the tallest mountain "that way." And points up the north area, a little ways off the road and in the direction you're travelling. "It... takes refuge top of the mountain. There is no path. Just hiding."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How tall is the mountain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "High."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know of a secret passageway to get up to it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Only fools would try to scale a dragon's mountain."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, well we're pretty stupid. Do you know of a path?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gives you a look of momentary indifference and kind of... no.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I don't believe him. I do not believe him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's giving you sass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He is giving me sass!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes. Can we-- what do we roll to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While they're talking, I'm going to loot the other bodies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you glance around the corpses, you find not too much on them, though it looks like they've gathered from raiding other people they're passing on the road, or just scavenging about. You find 274 gold.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Vex, can you do your detect dragon? Here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can actually!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Because I'm not quite there, at a thousand feet, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, you're saying that we need to not be out in the open, because the dragon is attracted to things that are not hidden?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hungry, it will take you. But that's your choice."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Have you ever seen it up close?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would you like to?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to come with us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then stop giving us sass!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You say you'll keep me alive but you walk towards death. One or the other way, "I end up at the bottom."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We talk towards glory.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see how fast we killed your friends? We're pretty amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then go. Go and see your dragon."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do you know of any more information on this dragon? That's all? Any weaknesses? Anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's given you everything he's gonna give you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, now you're on empty, I take my greataxe and I chop off his head.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Guys...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. Wait. Stop.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Now this is just not right!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the whole group gasps, Grog just shoves him back and (whoosh whoom, pff pff). The head rolls, hits a patch of snow and stops. The body falls back and you see kind of dark blood begin to pour out of the rest of the body and into the snow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You should have checked with our leader before you did that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Most definitely.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay. I think we're going to have to have a talk circle. Right now.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Okay. Before that, do any of the orc have any iron on them at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around, there are bits and pieces of, whether it be iron weapons-- you can see, scavenged a few-- like some of the axes that were being used have an iron or similar type metal that is crafted in those, though it's usually pretty beaten and not very well maintained.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Whatever I can, I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say you can harvest the iron blades from three axes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're in relatively poor condition, but you can mark that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, Lyra.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Are we doing a talk circle?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I think we need to discuss the fact that that was just very inappropriate and I am here as a leader and I think that that was just not right, we are better than that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We are. But here's the thing--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You did kill one of them too, though.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Lyra, we are going to kill-- we are on our way to kill something.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well, it's-- we had a deal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he probably would've led his friends to us to kill us.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: As a leader I choose not to pursue this any more, but I will register my disapproval, and I think we should just proceed, I'm very, I'm very vexed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's very fair, that's very fair.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Scanlan, can't you sing a song to make her feel better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could sing a song to make her feel better.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: But you don't want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sings) Scanlan make you feel good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At least she's not talking about Aldor, so I'm okay with it.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, did you want to, we haven't talked yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I-- we should go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You should write a song about Aldor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go over and I pick up the orc's head and I walk it over to Lyra and I go, here, I'm sorry, you can keep this. It won't happen without me asking again.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No, that's quite all right, it's--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, really, look, it's still got stuff in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he shakes it, you see spattering across the--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No, okay-- that's quite-- I think we should just proceed-- we should proceed, everyone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna try to see if there's a dragon within--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I say we could just cut out the tongue, it's not--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just the tongue?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like that yes, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rip the tongue out of the head.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's a good idea, Vex.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Do we need the pelt of the dire wolf?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put the orc tongue in the bag of holding. And the orc head. Both.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Just asking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With the lip, now we-- you're slowly--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The lip is in my belt, baby.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And I would like to extract the canines from the dire wolf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the dire wolf, all right. I would like you to go ahead and make a nature check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What's that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's to attempt to harvest the creature's canines.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's that? Sorry?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sorry, what do I do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d20 and add your nature check bonus.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, that sucks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I Primeval Awareness the dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you begin taking a small dagger out from the inside of your Cloak of Useful Things you break one of the tooths in the process, unfortunately. You manage to get one of them, at least, so you do have one dire wolf canine you can add to your items.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I would like to put my hands on the dire wolf and just thank it, for no other reason than I respect its life.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think he's going to answer.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You know, it's not for you, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh well, I'm just saying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The dragon, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm trying to be helpful.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I understand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you take a moment and concentrate and, for a six mile radius-- currently no dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Still? It's still-- oh right, it's towards a mountain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got another day's travel, it's got to be 20 miles away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we keep sleeping, or should we just pack it up now and go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it nighttime?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's still-- it's probably like a good two, three in the morning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, let's go back to bed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you say a new day has passed? So can I try for my beard again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We will once you get a full-on rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Let's fully rest. I'm going to make a leadership decision that hopefully everybody agrees with that we need more sleepytime.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it okay to keep sleeping right here, are they going to come search for us? Probably not more than one search party.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably not.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Probably not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm in my pyjamas, I'm going back to bed.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I think that's a good call that I agree with as the leader of this group.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What she said.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Are we always going to call it sleepytime?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I mean, that's.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'm just asking, I like to put labels on things. It's an OCD thing.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Whatever you would like to call it. Or just, yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, you're the leader, I shall accept whatever name--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes, sleepytime is the official name for it! (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sleepytime it is. Thank you so much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to sleepytime, good night, all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it-- is it still my watch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You did your job.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: You did your job.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take the next watch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks. (snores)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: May I?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: And we can heal up, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, so the rest of you guys, you go ahead and take your full evening's rest, at which point your hit points and spells are restored. And Grog, go ahead and make a percentage roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Come on, you big bearded bastard! 58.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you've still got that nice scruff, a good like, y'know, half an inch to an inch of whatever that is pushing through.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dire wolf blood all over my feet didn't stimulate the growth at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That blood looked quite black.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually you all complete your evening's rest, the rest of the watches go without incident, in the morning you wake up and the cold air was pretty rough for a lot of you. Thankfully the fire was there to help, but you're-- you get the feeling that the further north you travel, the weather's going to become an issue, even with the warm clothing you currently have on. All right. So you guys step back to where your horses are currently--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Our horses are okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, we forgot about those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thankfully, your horses were far enough away from the area where you were, the focus was not to make any noise when they came upon you, so the orcish party knew better than to attack the horses first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The horses are still a little spooked from the evening's events, but nevertheless. You get back on your horses, you continue up the Glasswalk Road. You had a question?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I use Beast Speech to calm them. Tell them everything shall be fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You have just got all sorts of shit.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Everything will be wonderful and thank you for leading us where we need to go. We shall try and make sure that no harm comes to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And immediately with that, the horses who were currently rattled, and some of them are being unresponsive to your attempts to mount them, settle down, come to a calm point and allow you all to get atop them without an issue.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The irony is, I was going to recommend Dust of Tracelessness, but that works too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that works too. Can you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They would never follow that, so.

lines.name: MATT
